title: Senior QA Automation
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you. 
Requirements for Senior Automation Engineer:
About Us:
 At Illuminate, a crucial branch of the NICE organization, we are not just committed to redefining quality standards in the tech world but are at the forefront of high technology innovation. As part of our dynamic team, you will work on products that include testing of next-generation AI technologies. This is an opportunity to be a part of an enterprise that contributes to building flagship applications for the world's leading banks and contact centers and takes pride in shaping the future with AI at its core.
 
Role Overview:
As a Senior Automation QA Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining our product quality. From setting up quality standards to actively participating in exploratory and automation tests, your expertise will ensure our software exceeds industry benchmarks. Working collaboratively with SW engineers, architects, and product managers, you'll gain unparalleled experience and actively shape real-life product delivery.
 
Responsibilities:

Load Testing Expertise: Design, develop, and execute performance and load tests using JMeter/Gatling to validate system performance and reliability. Analyze results, identify bottlenecks, and provide actionable insights.
API Testing: Automate end-to-end backend and orchestrator API testing. Craft detailed test cases, identify vulnerabilities, and ensure seamless integration and functionality.
Test Automation Frameworks: Continuously research, integrate, and manage the latest automation frameworks and tools that fit the company's needs, ensuring tests are reliable, fast, and efficient.
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Integrate automation tests into the CI/CD pipeline, ensuring immediate feedback on code quality and stability.
Collaboration: Work closely with development, operations, and product teams to understand system architecture, design, and functionalities. Provide feedback and solutions to improve software robustness.

 
Guide and actively participate in creation of Test Scenarios covering all Testing aspects (FR/NFR, positive/negative paths, effects on other use cases, etc.)

Actively participate in Exploratory and Automation test execution HO when needed.
Define Test Automation Approach and drive Automation coverage within the sprints.
Establish testing practices throughout the development lifecycle (unit, E2E)

Requirements

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience: as a software QA in multi-disciplinary products


Profound Experience in Load Testing: Demonstrated expertise in utilizing JMeter for performance and load testing, along with a proven track record of identifying and addressing system bottlenecks.
Multifaceted Automation Framework Skills: Proficiency in multiple automation frameworks including but not limited to:

       API Testing Tools: Postman.
       Unit Testing Frameworks: xUnit or similar frameworks.

Experience work in: Jira TPs management tool X-ray
Proven background: Promoting activities from the idea phase to implementation
Experience in: working with Enterprise and Complex systems.
System view: and technology deep understanding
Debug experience (BE) products  
CI/CD Integration: Experience integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines for immediate feedback on system reliability and performance. 
Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a meticulous attention to detail.

 
Advantages

Experience in: environment creation (AWS/Asure/Images win, Linux)
Web Automation Tools: Cypress, Playwright, Selenium.
Experience: as system QA
CI/CD infrastructure Kubernetes/Dockers knowledge
